Brad Paulson and Paul Collins from Hegel and Pete Soderberg from MartinLogan will be there to...
text:
ATTENTION ALL AUDIO SOCIETIES--we have a page on the Stereophile website
devoted to you: [stereophile.com/audiophile-
societies](http://stereophile.com/audiophile-societies). If you'd like to have
your audio-society information posted on the site, email Chris Vogel at
[vgl@cfl.rr.com](mailto:vgl@cfl.rr.com). (Please note the new email address.)

Please note that it is inappropriate for a retailer to promote a new product
line in "Calendar" unless it is associated with a seminar or similar event.

Unless they are listed here, please assume that meetings listed in previous
issues have been canceled. Even if they are listed here, they could still be
canceled.

CALIFORNIA

* Sunday, May 17, 2-5pm: Maybe, tentatively, we'll see: The Los Angeles & Orange County Audio Society may hold its monthly meeting at Sunny's Audio Video in Covina (1370 E. Cypress St.; [sunnyaudiovideo.com](http://sunnyaudiovideo.com)). Sunny's will feature Martin-Logan ESL and Motion series loudspeakers with electronics and turntables from Hegel, NAD, Technics, Brinkmann, Meridian, MSB, and more. Brad Paulson and Paul Collins from Hegel and Pete Soderberg from MartinLogan will be there to talk about their products and offer show specials. A raffle is planned, and a glorious lunch will be served. Free parking is nearby. Guests, visitors, and new members are invited. For more information, visit [laocas.com](http://laocas.com) or call the new president and CEO of the society, Mike Wechsberg, at (714) 906-9780.

* Saturday, June 6,1-4pm: The San Francisco Audiophile Society will-hopefully--be hosting Rick Schultz, the owner and CEO of High Fidelity Cables, pending the status of the COVID-19 social distancing restrictions. Rick's talks are always an educational and interesting discussion about how magnetic conduction can improve the signal transmitted through conductors, thus improving the resulting sound quality. As usual, we'll have snacks and drinks available. Please contact the San Francisco Audiophile Society at [query@sfaudiophilesociety.com](mailto:query@sfaudiophilesociety.com) or consult our website, sanfranciscoaudiophilesociety. com, for more information.

* Saturday and Sunday, June 20-21: CanJam SoCal 2020, which was to be held at Irvine Marriott in Irvine (18000 Von Karman Ave.), will definitely not happen, as it has been postponed until December 12-13. Lunch, therefore, will not be served.

* Sunday, July 26,1-4pm: If public health policies allow, the Los Angeles & Orange County Audio Society will hold its monthly meeting at Common Wave Hi-Fi in Los Angeles (1451 E 4th Street, Suite 106, [commonwave.net](http://commonwave.net)). Host Wesley Katzir and staff will present the latest speakers from YG Acoustics, including the Sonja 2.2 and Carmel 2. Vignettes will feature electronics from Nagra, including the new HD 2020 amplifiers, HD Preamplifier, and Tube DAC, as well as the new Simaudio Moon 700iV2 and 680D. Turntables from Kuzma, Pear Audio Blue, and Dr. Feickert as well as cartridges from EMT, Dynavector, and Koetsu will be on display. Representatives from YG Acoustics, Nagra, and Simaudio will be available to answer any questions. Parking is available and free. Guests, visitors, and members alike are invited. Space will be limited, and demos will be scheduled throughout the day. To reserve your spot, please contact Common Wave Hi-Fi at (213) 277-4434 or [info@commonwave.net](mailto:info@commonwave.net), visit [laocas.com](http://laocas.com), or call President and CEO Mike Wechsberg at (714) 906-9780.

title: CALENDAR OF INDUSTRY EVENTS.(INDUSTRY UPDATE: AUDIO NEWS & VIEWS)(Calendar)
html:
ATTENTION ALL AUDIO SOCIETIES--we have a page on the Stereophile website devoted to you: stereophile.com/audiophile-societies. If you'd like to have your audio-society information posted on the site, email Chris Vogel at vgl@cfl.rr.com. (Please note the new email address.)

Please note that it is inappropriate for a retailer to promote a new product line in "Calendar" unless it is associated with a seminar or similar event.

Unless they are listed here, please assume that meetings listed in previous issues have been canceled. Even if they are listed here, they could still be canceled.

CALIFORNIA

* Sunday, May 17, 2-5pm: Maybe, tentatively, we'll see: The Los Angeles & Orange County Audio Society may hold its monthly meeting at Sunny's Audio Video in Covina (1370 E. Cypress St.; sunnyaudiovideo.com). Sunny's will feature Martin-Logan ESL and Motion series loudspeakers with electronics and turntables from Hegel, NAD, Technics, Brinkmann, Meridian, MSB, and more. Brad Paulson and Paul Collins from Hegel and Pete Soderberg from MartinLogan will be there to talk about their products and offer show specials. A raffle is planned, and a glorious lunch will be served. Free parking is nearby. Guests, visitors, and new members are invited. For more information, visit laocas.com or call the new president and CEO of the society, Mike Wechsberg, at (714) 906-9780.

* Saturday, June 6,1-4pm: The San Francisco Audiophile Society will-hopefully--be hosting Rick Schultz, the owner and CEO of High Fidelity Cables, pending the status of the COVID-19 social distancing restrictions. Rick's talks are always an educational and interesting discussion about how magnetic conduction can improve the signal transmitted through conductors, thus improving the resulting sound quality. As usual, we'll have snacks and drinks available. Please contact the San Francisco Audiophile Society at query@sfaudiophilesociety.com or consult our website, sanfranciscoaudiophilesociety. com, for more information.

* Saturday and Sunday, June 20-21: CanJam SoCal 2020, which was to be held at Irvine Marriott in Irvine (18000 Von Karman Ave.), will definitely not happen, as it has been postponed until December 12-13. Lunch, therefore, will not be served.

* Sunday, July 26,1-4pm: If public health policies allow, the Los Angeles & Orange County Audio Society will hold its monthly meeting at Common Wave Hi-Fi in Los Angeles (1451 E 4th Street, Suite 106, commonwave.net). Host Wesley Katzir and staff will present the latest speakers from YG Acoustics, including the Sonja 2.2 and Carmel 2. Vignettes will feature electronics from Nagra, including the new HD 2020 amplifiers, HD Preamplifier, and Tube DAC, as well as the new Simaudio Moon 700iV2 and 680D. Turntables from Kuzma, Pear Audio Blue, and Dr. Feickert as well as cartridges from EMT, Dynavector, and Koetsu will be on display. Representatives from YG Acoustics, Nagra, and Simaudio will be available to answer any questions. Parking is available and free. Guests, visitors, and members alike are invited. Space will be limited, and demos will be scheduled throughout the day. To reserve your spot, please contact Common Wave Hi-Fi at (213) 277-4434 or info@commonwave.net, visit laocas.com, or call President and CEO Mike Wechsberg at (714) 906-9780.
